intro: Chrysanthemum balsamita, commonly known as golden balsam, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and branching. This herb is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.
